0.content:
WHERE
    (vehicle.stage_no = '1' or vehicle.stage_no = '0')
SELECT
    vehicle.stage.engine.group,
    vehicle.stage.engine.group_hex,
    launch_date.year,
    --sum(orb_pay) as fuel_contribution,
    (fuel_contribution /  sum(sum(orb_pay) by launch_date.year, vehicle.stage.engine.group) by launch_date.year)*100 -> percent_orbital_payload,
HAVING
    fuel_contribution > 0
;
0.name: % of Year's Payload to Orbit (tonnes) by First Stage Fuel

2.content:
WHERE
    vehicle.stage_no = '1'
SELECT
    stage_identifier,
    org.state_code,
    org.hex,
    sum(orb_pay)-> orbital_payload,
ORDER BY
    orbital_payload desc
LIMIT 10
;
2.name: First Stage Example Launchers

content.markdown:
# Orbital Rocket Propellant Through The Years

Click charts to cross-filter. Global filters can be applied in the top search bar. Click 'edit' to customize everything - the dashboard is local to you, and safe to change. 

Data: *McDowell, Jonathan C., 2020. General Catalog of Artificial Space Objects, Release 1.7.3 , https://planet4589.org/space/gcat*

Rocket propulsion has relied on a wide range of fuels, each balancing power, efficiency, and practicality. Early spaceflight was dominated by kerosene and hypergolic propellants that were reliable, storable, and suited for military use as many rockets were derived from military vehicles. Solid propellants enabled rapid-response launches and missiles. Over time, liquid oxygen + kerosene (LOX/Kero) became the workhorse of general purpose orbital launch, while LOX/Liquid Hydrogen offered unmatched efficiency for upper stages. Recently, new combinations like LOX/Methane are emerging, aiming for cleaner performance, reusability, and payload maximization.

content.query:
import std.display;
WHERE
    vehicle.stage_no in ('0', '1')
SELECT
    launch_count,
    sum(orb_pay) as payload_to_orbit,
    count(vehicle.full_name) as rockets,
    round(avg(group(vehicle.stage.engine.isp) by flight_id),2) -> average_isp,
    array_sort(array_agg(
        struct(
        round(coalesce(sum(orb_pay) by vehicle.stage.engine.fuel,0),3)  ->payload , 
        vehicle.stage.engine.fuel  ->fuel,
        count(launch_tag) by vehicle.stage.engine.fuel -> launches,
        @calc_percent(
            (count(launch_tag ? was_complete_success ) by vehicle.stage.engine.fuel), 
            (count(launch_tag) by vehicle.stage.engine.fuel)
            , 2
         )*100 ->success_rate 
       
         )
    ), desc) as fuel_payloads
;

import std.display;
WHERE
    vehicle.stage_no in ('2', '3', '4')
SELECT
    launch_count,
    sum(orb_pay) as payload_to_orbit,
    count(vehicle.full_name) as rockets,
    round(avg(group(vehicle.stage.engine.isp) by flight_id),2) -> average_isp,
    array_sort(array_agg(
        struct(
        round(coalesce(sum(orb_pay) by vehicle.stage.engine.fuel,0),3)  ->payload , 
        vehicle.stage.engine.fuel  ->fuel,
        count(launch_tag) by vehicle.stage.engine.fuel -> launches,
        @calc_percent(
            (count(launch_tag ? was_complete_success ) by vehicle.stage.engine.fuel), 
            (count(launch_tag) by vehicle.stage.engine.fuel)
            , 2
         )*100 ->success_rate 
       
         )
    ), desc) as fuel_payloads
;

7.content:
WHERE
    vehicle.stage_no in ('2', '3', '4')
    and vehicle.stage.engine.group is not null
SELECT
    vehicle.stage.engine.group,
    vehicle.stage.engine.group_hex,
    launch_date.year,
    --sum(orb_pay) as fuel_contribution,
    (fuel_contribution /  sum(sum(orb_pay) by launch_date.year, vehicle.stage.engine.group) by launch_date.year)*100 -> percent_orbital_payload,

having fuel_contribution>0;
7.name: % of Year's Payload to Orbit (tonnes) by Upper Stage Fuel

9.content:
WHERE
    vehicle.stage_no in ('2', '3', '4')
SELECT
    stage_identifier,
    org.state_code,
    org.hex,
    sum(orb_pay) -> orbital_payload,
ORDER BY
    orbital_payload desc
LIMIT 10
;
9.name: Upper Stage Launchers

10.content:
SELECT
    org.flag,
ORDER BY
    org.flag asc
;
10.name: National Grouping (Click to filter, click title to clear)

11.content:
SELECT
    vehicle.stage.engine.group,
    vehicle.stage.engine.fuel,
    vehicle.stage.engine.fuel_hex,
    sum(orb_pay) -> payload_to_orbit,
    count(launch_tag ? orb_pay >0) as orbital_launches,
having
    vehicle.stage.engine.fuel is not null
ORDER BY
    orbital_launches desc
LIMIT 30
;
11.name: Fuel Groups

12.content:
WHERE
    (vehicle.stage_no = '1')
SELECT
    vehicle.stage.engine.group,
    vehicle.stage.engine.name,
    vehicle.stage.engine.isp,
    vehicle.stage.engine.thrust,
    vehicle.stage.engine.group_hex,
    launch_count,
having 
    cast(vehicle.stage.engine.isp as int)>30 
order by launch_count desc
limit 150;
12.name: By Engine: ISP vs Thrust

13.content:
WHERE
    vehicle.stage_no in ('2', '3', '4')
SELECT
    vehicle.stage.engine.group,
    vehicle.stage.engine.name,
    vehicle.stage.engine.isp,
    vehicle.stage.engine.thrust,
    vehicle.stage.engine.group_hex,
    launch_count
having 
    cast(vehicle.stage.engine.isp as int)>30
order by
    launch_count desc
limit 150;
13.name: Upper Stage Engines: ISP vs Thrust

15.content:
SELECT
    era
ORDER BY
    era asc

;
15.name: Space Era (Click to filter, click title to clear)

16.content:
WHERE
    vehicle.stage_no in ('2', '3', '4')
SELECT
    launch_date.year,
    sum(orb_pay) as payload_to_orbit,
    launch_count;
16.name: Total Upper Stage Payload

17.content:
WHERE
    vehicle.stage_no in ('0', '1')
SELECT
    launch_date.year,
    sum(orb_pay) as payload_to_orbit,
    launch_count;
17.name: Total First Stage Payload to Orbit

content.markdown:
## Fuel Groups

The charts are broken down by either specific fuels or fuel group, which are typically fuel/oxidizer pairs. (Rocket combustion typically uses both an oxidizing agent and a reducing agent (fuel), though there are monopropellents used, such as [Hydrazine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydrazine)). The current filters, we're looking at {group_count} fuel/oxidizer pairs and {fuel_count} total fuels.
